 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎תְּרַע‎</span> **noun [masculine]** ==gate, door== ([[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] Syriac; Biblical Hebrew  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שַׁ֫עַר‎</span>, √I. <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎שׁער‎</span>); — construct <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎ת‎</span>: 

**1.** ***door*** of furnace [[Dan.3.26|Dan 3:26]]. 

**2.** ***gate*** of king, i.e. palace, court, [[Dan.2.29|Dan 2:29]] (compare [[Esth.2.19|Esth 2:19]], see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שַׁ֫עַר‎</span> **3 a**; also Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***gate***, then <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***the court*** of a sovereign; plural <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***Sublime Porte***, of Turkish court, see especially [[BDB#Dozy|Dozy]]<sup>i. 124</sup>).
